title: HTH/XRE Regulators at Mobile Element Junctions
description: This feature detects regions containing transcriptional regulatory proteins, particularly those with helix-turn-helix (HTH) or XRE-family domains. The feature activates precisely at the location of these regulatory genes, which are frequently positioned at the boundaries of mobile genetic elements (phage genes, conjugation systems, integrons). The biological function appears to be identification of control points for horizontal gene transfer and mobile element expression. The pattern is highly consistent across the examples, appearing in diverse bacterial phyla (Proteobacteria, Firmicutes, Actinobacteria), suggesting this is a fundamental pattern in bacterial genome organization related to transcriptional control of mobile genetic elements.
